thread.section_title: WDT News Feed: Watertown Daily Times: Local Sports
thread.title: High school roundup: Watertown opens Section 3 tournament with victory
thread.title_full: High school roundup: Watertown opens Section 3 tournament with victory

title: High school roundup: Watertown opens Section 3 tournament with victory
text:
A A 
WATERTOWN — Brian Netto scored in the 45th minute as the eighth-seeded Watertown boys soccer team beat No. 9 Homer, 1-0, in a Section 3 Class A first round game Thursday night. 
Ethan Baytos assisted on the goal and Caleb Kolb made seven saves for the Cyclones (11-4-2 overall). Watertown next takes on top-seeded Fowler in the quarterfinals at 5 p.m. Friday at Corcoran High School. 
Lucien St. John stopped eight shots for the Trojans (8-9). 
FULTON 8, INDIAN RIVER 2 
Ian Devendorf and Austin Wilde each supplied two goals and an assist as the third-seeded Red Raiders routed the No. 14 Warriors in Class A first round game at Fulton. 
Austin Beckwith added two goals for Fulton (12-4-1), which hosts sixth-seeded East Syracuse-Minoa at a date and time to be determined. 
Ty Godin and Dylan Wagstaff scored for Indian River (8-9). 
SACKETS HARBOR 5, POLAND 1 
Shea Lynch scored three goals, and the sixth-seeded Patriots built a 5-0 lead by the 32nd minute en route to a Class D first-round victory over the No. 11 Tornadoes (8-7-2) in Sackets Harbor. 
Sackets Harbor will play No. 3 Blessed Virgin Mary at a time to be determined Friday. 
Chase Urbanowicz and Nathan Fillingham each added one goal and one assist, Cadin Berie provided two assists, and Alex Keegan stopped two shots for the Patriots (13-4). 
COPENHAGEN 5, ALEXANDRIA 1 
Connor Eddy scored three goals and Brandon Buckley made nine saves to guide the ninth-seeded Golden Knights to a Class D first-round win over the No. 8 Purple Ghosts (10-6) in Alexandria Bay. 
Copenhagen will play top-seeded Bishop Ludden (11-3) in the quarterfinals at 7 p.m. Friday at Onondaga Community College. 
Ethan Atnip added a goal and an assist for the Golden Knights (11-5). 
BLESSED VIRGIN MARY 6, LAFARGEVILLE 0 
Andrew Page and Michael Urankar each scored twice as the third-seeded Saints blanked the No. 14 Red Knights in a Class D first-round game at Warners. 
Atanasio Deravsquin chipped in with a goal and an assist for Blessed Virgin Mary (14-3). 
Thomas O’Driscoll made 12 saves for LaFargeville (5-9-1). 
HEUVELTON 0, HERMON-DEKALB 0 (OT) 
Jordan Macaulay made four saves and No. 8 Heuvelton advanced to the quarterfinals with a 5-4 win over No. 9 Hermon-DeKalb in a shootout in a Section 10 Class D first-round game in Heuvelton. 
Heuvelton (7-9-1 overall) will face No. 1 Parishville-Hopkinton in a quarterfinal at 6:45 p.m. Friday at SUNY Canton. 
Dawson Kerr finished with 12 saves for the Demons (3-11-2). 
Ben Jacobs, Cole Piercey, Michael Martin, Colin Trathen and Victor Gagnon scored in the shootout for Heuvelton. Kerr, Ryan Brown, Hunter Woodrow and Dylan Burwell scored for the Demons. 
MADRID-WADDINGTON 9, CLIFTON-FINE 0 
John Lenney and Shane Cryderman each scored two goals to lead the No. 5 Yellowjackets past the No. 12 Eagles (0-13) in a Class D first-round game in Madrid. 
Madrid-Waddington (10-7) will face No. 4 Lisbon in a quarterfinal at 5 p.m. Friday at SUNY Canton. 
Dan Dominie, Aaron Armstrong, Tanner Uppstrom, Loring Hill and Cody McCall also scored for Madrid-Waddington. Jordan Arquitt made three saves for the shutout. 
HAMMOND 4, ST. REGIS FALLS 1 
John Boland scored one goal and assisted on another as the No. 6 Red Devils defeated the No. 11 Saints (1-15-1) in a Class D first-round game in Hammond will face No. 3 Harrisville in a quarterfinal at 6 p.m. Friday at Potsdam High School. 
Ryan Vollmer, Brady Elliott and Brett Gleason all scored for the Red Devils. Conner LaBar scored for the Saints. 
COLTON-PIERREPONT 1, EDWARDS-KNOX 0 
Ethan Riley scored off a pass from Riley Doyle with 58 seconds left in the first half to lead the No. 7 Colts past the No. 10 Cougars (3-11-1) in a Class D first-round game in South Colton. 
Colton-Pierrepont (7-9-1) will face No. 2 Chateaugay in a quarterfinal at 7:45 p.m. Friday at Potsdam High School. 
Mark Dumas made four saves for the shutout. 
VOLLEYBALL 
MASSENA 3, SALMON RIVER 0 
Sabrina Sunday scored 15 service points and added nine kills to lead the Red Raiders (16-0, 10-0) to a 25-11, 25-22, 25-23 win over the Shamrocks in a Northern Athletic Conference East Division match in Masserna. 
Nina Rourke and Aryanna Jacobs each scored 11 points for Massena and Tatum Lafrance produced 17 assists. 
Mara Lazore led Salmon River (12-4, 6-4) with 10 points. 
CHATEAUGAY 3, MALONE 0 
Chateaugay (14-2, 8-2) picked up a 25-14, 25-18, 25-20 sweep of the Huskies in an East Division match in Malone. Melissa Kemp scored nine points for the Huskies (5-11, 1-9). 
GOUVERNEUR 3, EDWARDS-KNOX 2 
Shannon Knowlton scored 21 points and added eight kills to lead Gouverneur to a 11-25, 7-25, 25-17, 25-19, 25-18 win over Edwards-Knox (3-12, 2-7) in a West Division match in Russell. 
Katie Erdman added nine assists and MaryKate Wainwright scored eight points for the Wildcats (2-13, 2-7).
